meanings.def: showing you do not think that you are as important as other people
examples: Be humble enough to learn from your mistakes.
my humble tribute to this great man
She was very humble and apologetic.
an amazing man who makes you feel quite humble
She felt humble and grateful but couldn't put her feelings into words.
She's a loving, kind and humble woman.

meanings.def: used to suggest that you are not as important as other people, but in a way that is not sincere or not very serious
examples: In my humble opinion, you were in the wrong.
My humble apologies. I did not understand.

meanings.def: having a low rank or social position
examples: a man of humble birth/origins
a humble occupation
the daughter of a humble shopkeeper
She was the daughter of a humble carpenter and a washerwoman.
He was a man who had risen from humble origins through hard work and good fortune.
He is intensely proud of his humble background.
He had worked his way up from humble beginnings.
a man of fairly humble origins

meanings.def: not large or special in any way
examples: a humble farmhouse
The company has worked its way up from humble beginnings to become the market leader.
Most of us have never considered the humble potato as a precious gift from nature.

meanings.def: to say and show that you are sorry for a mistake that you made

idioms.def: to say and show that you are sorry for a mistake that you made

meanings.def: to make somebody feel that they are not as good or important as they thought they were
examples: He was humbled by her generosity.
a humbling experience

meanings.def: to easily defeat an opponent, especially a strong or powerful one
examples: be humbled The world champion was humbled last night in three rounds.

meanings.def: to show that you are not too proud to ask for something, admit that you have been wrong, etc.
examples: He refused to humble himself and ask her forgiveness.
